favourite.article: He's making His home in our hearts—our being (mind emotion will and conscience)—as in every room and avenue of our person. Why? That we can know, WITH all the saints who are also allowing God to permeate their heart, who He is — the breadth, length, height, DEPTH of God. If we want to know God in a deep way, it starts with knowing God in your own heart. Only then are we given the privilege to see God in the hearts of other men—other saints in His Body. Your individual pursuit for the corporate Christ is NEVER in vain; don't ever let the enemy tell you otherwise—redeem the time!
Love this song! It's my favorite hymn.
Eph. 3:16-19 the heavenly prescription to solve all of our problems. Oh, that Christ would make His home in our hearts!
Christ! Make Your home in our heart!
O that Christ may make His home my heart, Spread Himself in every part! Saturate and life impart! That with all saints, I may apprehend All the vast dimensions of my loving Christ.
O Lord Jesus make my heart Your home and Spread Yourself in every part!
God Himself is looking for a place to call home.
O Lord, make Your home in my heart! Saturate me Lord!
Oh Lord...make Your home in my heart ...spread Yourself into every part saturate and love impart....PTL.
Praise the Lord for 'O that Christ may make His home'. It gives me strength, encouragement, and satisfy with the Lord. Amen.
This is something of experiencing the Lord through the saints where the Lord dispenses Himself, for Him to make His home in us.
I like how uplifting this tune is despite the desperate tone of the verses. Hehe. Catchy tune, easy to learn, and a good way turn ourselves back to Him as our source and supply!

We had a glorious Bible-reading session on Ephesians and thoroughly enjoyed singing this hymn as a conclusion to our gathering with several Nigerian brothers studying here in Kuching. Praise Him for all the saints with whom we can apprehend His full dimensions!

I came upon this song while searching for hymns and it instantly ministered to me. I was touched with tears welling up in my eyes. Thank God for the saints with whom we can be strong to apprehend the awesome dimensions of Christ.
